Description of incident: "The Buckle Inc., an apparel retailer that operates more than 450 stores in 44 U.S. states, disclosed Friday that its retail locations were hit by malicious software designed to steal customer credit card data. The disclosure came hours after KrebsOnSecurity contacted the company regarding reports from sources in the financial sector about a possible breach at the retailer. The Buckle released a statement saying that point-of-sale malware was found installed on cash registers at the company’s retail stores, and that it believes the malware was stealing customer credit card data between Oct. 28, 2016 and April 14, 2017. The Buckle said purchases made on its online store were not affected."
